div1.p: United States District Court Western District of Washington Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Antonio Bisegna, alias Disegna, for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2679 Filed Feb. , 194.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus. Denied.
Alred H. Lundin Louis E. Shela Fro Petitioner
Clay Allen, U.S. Attorney, G.P. Fishburne, Asst. U.S. Atty. For Respondent.

On the 5th day of December, 1913, the acting Secretary of labor issued a warrant of arrrest for the petitioner, charging that he is an alien belonging to the "excluded classes" and likely to become a public charge at the time of his entry into the United States. Thereafter on the 15th day of December, 1913, he was accorded a hearing, and on the 6th day of January, 1914, at the request of the attorney for the petitioner, the hearing was re-opened and furthertestimony presented. Thereafter findings made by the immigration inspector recommended that the petitioner be deported. On the 26th day of January, 1914, the secretary of labor directed that petitioner be returned to Italy, the country from whence he came. On the 16th day of Feburary a petition for a writ of habeas corpus was filed and writ issued, in response to which the commissioner of immigration produced the petitioner in court together with a return and answer to the petition.

From the record as it is presented and the consideration of the authorities on the argument, I think the writ should be dismissed, an d the petitioner will be remanded to the commissioner of immigration.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
Filed in teh U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division FEB 25 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, By EML Deputy
